field.filter: SELECT Rack WHERE location_id= :this->location_id
SELECT Enclosure WHERE rack_id= :this->rack_id
SELECT PowerConnection WHERE location_id = :this->location_id AND finalclass IN ("PDU","acups","dcpowerrectifier","DCDB")
SELECT PowerConnection WHERE location_id = :this->location_id AND finalclass IN ("PDU","acups","dcpowerrectifier","DCDB")

method.comment: /** * Placeholder for backward compatibility (iTop <= 2.1.0) * in case an extension attempts to redefine this function... */

neighbour.query_down: SELECT ConnectableCI AS d JOIN lnkConnectableCIToNetworkDevice AS l1 ON l1.connectableci_id = d.id WHERE l1.networkdevice_id = :this->id AND l1.connection_type='downlink'
neighbour.query_up: SELECT NetworkDevice AS nw JOIN lnkConnectableCIToNetworkDevice AS l1 ON l1.networkdevice_id = nw.id WHERE l1.connectableci_id = :this->id AND l1.connection_type='downlink'

field.filter: SELECT CircuitType

method.comment: /** * Placeholder for backward compatibility (iTop <= 2.1.0) * in case an extension attempts to redefine this function... */

neighbour.query_down: SELECT DatacenterDevice WHERE powerA_id = :this->id OR powerB_id = :this->id
neighbour.query_up: SELECT PowerConnection WHERE id = :this->powerA_id OR id = :this->powerB_id

neighbour.query_down: SELECT ACDB WHERE powerstartA_id = :this->id OR powerstartB_id = :this->id
neighbour.query_up: SELECT PowerConnection WHERE id = :this->powerstartA_id OR id = :this->powerstartB_id

field.filter: SELECT Service AS s JOIN lnkCustomerContractToService AS l1 ON l1.service_id=s.id JOIN CustomerContract AS cc ON l1.customercontract_id=cc.id WHERE cc.org_id = :this->org_id AND s.status != 'obsolete'
SELECT ServiceSubcategory WHERE service_id = :this->service_id AND request_type = 'incident' AND status != 'obsolete'

SELECT Service AS s JOIN lnkCustomerContractToService AS l1 ON l1.service_id=s.id JOIN CustomerContract AS cc ON l1.customercontract_id=cc.id WHERE cc.org_id = :this->org_id AND s.status != 'obsolete'
SELECT ServiceSubcategory WHERE service_id = :this->service_id AND request_type = :this->request_type AND status != 'obsolete'

dashlet.query: SELECT `WorkOrder` FROM WorkOrder AS `WorkOrder` WHERE ((`WorkOrder`.`status` = 'open') AND (`WorkOrder`.`agent_id` = :current_contact_id))

dashlet.title: Incidents - for my teams and myself
dashlet.subtitle: Incidents
dashlet.query: SELECT Incident AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status != "closed" AND i.status != "resolved" UNION SELECT Incident AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id

SELECT Incident AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status != "closed" AND i.status != "resolved" UNION SELECT Incident AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id AND i.status != "closed" AND i.status != "resolved"

dashlet.title: Requests - for my teams and myself
dashlet.subtitle: Request
dashlet.query: SELECT UserRequest AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status != "closed" UNION SELECT UserRequest AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id

SELECT UserRequest AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status NOT IN ("closed", "resolved") UNION SELECT UserRequest AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id AND i.status NOT IN ("closed", "resolved")

dashlet.title: Changes - for my teams and myself
dashlet.subtitle: Changes
dashlet.query: SELECT Change AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) UNION SELECT Change AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id

SELECT Change AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status NOT IN ("closed", "implemented") UNION SELECT Change AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id AND i.status NOT IN ("closed", "implemented")

dashlet.title: Problems - for my teams and myself
dashlet.subtitle: My Problems
dashlet.query: SELECT Problem AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) UNION SELECT Problem AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id

SELECT Problem AS i WHERE ((i.operational_status = 'ongoing') AND (i.agent_id = :current_contact_id)) AND i.status NOT IN ('closed', 'resolved') UNION SELECT Problem AS i JOIN Team AS t ON i.team_id = t.id JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS lnk ON lnk.team_id = t.id WHERE lnk.person_id = :current_contact_id AND i.status NOT IN ('closed', 'resolved')
SELECT Team AS t JOIN lnkPersonToTeam AS l1 ON l1.team_id=t.id JOIN Person AS p ON l1.person_id=p.id WHERE p.id = :current_contact_id

dashlet.title: UI-IncidentManagementOverview-OpenIncidentByStatus
dashlet.query: SELECT Incident WHERE status NOT IN ('closed','rejected')

dashlet.title: UI-IncidentManagementOverview-OpenIncidentByAgent
dashlet.query: SELECT Incident WHERE status NOT IN ('closed','rejected')

dashlet.title: UI-IncidentManagementOverview-OpenIncidentByCustomer
dashlet.query: SELECT Incident WHERE status NOT IN ('closed','rejected')

menu.oql: SELECT Incident WHERE agent_id = :current_contact_id AND status NOT IN ("closed","resolved")
SELECT Incident WHERE status IN ("escalated_tto", "escalated_ttr") OR escalation_flag="yes"
SELECT Incident WHERE status NOT IN ("closed")

profile.name: Configuration Manager
profile.description: Person in charge of the documentation of the managed CIs

profile.name: Service Desk Agent
profile.description: Person in charge of creating incidents, requests, problems and changes. Read only for CMDB, Service, Subservice and IP Objects

profile.name: Support Agent
profile.description: Person analyzing and solving the current incidents

profile.name: Problem Manager
profile.description: Person analyzing and solving the current problems

profile.name: Change Supervisor
profile.description: Person responsible for the overall change execution

profile.name: Change Approver
profile.description: Person who could be impacted by some changes

profile.name: Service Manager
profile.description: Person responsible for the service delivered to the [internal] customer

profile.name: Portal user
profile.description: Has the rights to access to the user portal. People having this profile will not be allowed to access the standard application, they will be automatically redirected to the user portal.

profile.name: Portal power user
profile.description: Users having this profile will have the rights to see all the tickets for a customer in the portal. Must be used in conjunction with other profiles (e.g. Portal User).
